title: Rockhurst High School STEAM Blog
description: A blog for the Rockhurst High School STEAM program used to document our STEM accreditation. The blog is built using Jekyll and hosted on GitHub Pages. The blog was updated by students and teachers in the program.

title: Layouts and Pumpfakes
description: I wanted to do 40 sites in 40 nights, but I only made it to 1. I made Pandora.

title: Ace Processing
description: A drag and drop for Procesing PDE projects to quickly review student submissions. The website uses the Ace Editor to allow users to write Processing code and see the results in real time. The website is built using processing.js and hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: Two Party Visualizer
description: A data visualization of word counts from perceptions of two different groups. The data is pulled from a Google Sheet and displayed using D3.js.

title: Freshman Retreat
description: A quiz game website for the Rockhurst High School Freshman Retreat. The was combines a multiple choice quiz game with YouTube embeds and uses React to pull data from a Google Sheet.

title: Park Crossing - Paint Chips
description: A website for the Park Crossing neighborhood in Kansas City. The website was built using jQuery and pulls data from a Google Sheet.

title: Johnny Jo's Pizzeria
description: The original website I made for Johnny Jo's Pizzeria. I got a free pizza and a t-shirt for helping a friend out. The website was built using Bootstrap and hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: The Pizzeria
description: A website for a now-closed pizzeria. The website was built using Bootstrap and hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: PrettyPrintCopy
description: A website to help students format their code for copy and paste. The website was built using jQuery and hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: WordsPerMinute
description: My own random character typing test. I wanted to integrate this into an LMS for Intro CS

name: EmailStrip
description: A simple website to drop plain text anything and have all the emails stripped and moved to a clipboard, one per line

name: Ortholog Search App
description: I contributed to Chris Stillmanâ€™s open source project, for some genetic sequencing research at KU. In this project, we cut down runtime by taking O(n2) solution down to O(nlogn) by using maps instead of lists. The Heroku router drops a long-running request after 30 seconds, but the dyno behind it continues processing the request until completion. Adding a timeout ensures that the dyno itself drops the long-running request, creating capacity for other requests.

title: RGB Sliders
description: A simple website to adjust the RGB values of a color
